reviews.text: My kids fave weekend restaurant since young and we decided to try their unlimited buffet for my son‚Äôs birthday celebrations. Great value, for the variety and spread! Don‚Äôt forget to leave some room ‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs 48 ice-cream flavours and desserts galore to indulge in! Friendly and helpful crew esp Ikye and Ann! Overall a nice ES visit, especially for Swensen‚Äôs fansüòäüëçüèª

Ridiculous system for this day and age. No one was managing the queue on 5 May. Walk ins and people with pre-bookings are made to wait in same line. Really? It not only waste the time for walk-in customers who might not know the rules, but also those of us who made the effort to do a pre-booking. Swensons, you can do much better than this!

Was craving for a tenderloin and this place didn't disappoint. My mum ordered a pan-seared barramundi, which was thick and fresh. Got the salad bar with my tenderloin and was surprised that in addition to salad, there was a selection of sliced bread  (multi grain, sourdough), fruit, prawn crackers, cheese and soup.

Finished off with the quintessential banana split and a single scoop of durian ice cream. Swensens ice creams are the best! Service however was rather slow, staff didn't seem knowledgeable, so that detracted a bit from the experience.

Good food and got wide range to eat, from main food, side dish, salad, dessert, various icecream favour, soft drinks; coffee and tea.
Staff here are friendly and helpful.

Came for a dept lunch. We had the set lunch. The salad bar had a good spread of food, with soups. The service staff was very friendly and efficient despite serving a big group of us - 70 persons. The lunch was good. We had the salad bar, soft drinks, main course and also ice cream.
